answerText: Virgil [or Publius Vergilius Maro][10] An apocryphal story about Charles I says that he tried out the sortes vergiliane and ended up flipping to the passage this Queen of Carthage calls for an unknown avenger against Aeneas and then burns herself to death.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 7 | 1 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This figure constructed a large statue collection that pointed to rebellious provinces. [10] Name this magician and necromancer who made a giant golden fly that ensured no real flies would trouble the inhabitants of Naples. He was once humiliatingly caught in a basket while trying to seduce a woman in a tower.
